description.narrative: Public oversight bodies related to children, including the Parliament, Ombudsman's Office, Anti-Discrimination Commissioner, civil society organizations and the media, increasingly demand accountability of duty-bearers for better governance results for children.

mailing-address.narrative: Rr. Skenderbej Ndertesa Volkswagen kati 3 Tirana Albania

sector.narrative: CRC, CEDAW or CRPD - follow up on concluding observations
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Independent national child rights institution / ombudsperson
Legal and policy framework related to violence, exploitation and abuse
PF4C: Improving public expenditure effectiveness / efficiency
Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
System strengthening for adolescent participation and civic engagement (including in humanitarian settings)

description.narrative: Justice, Law and Order human rights affairs
Other General Services support to civil society

title.narrative: Albania United Nations Development Assistance Framework
UNICEF Contract Awards through the UN Global Marketplace
UNICEF Tender Notices through the UN Global Marketplace

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Public oversight bodies related to children, including the Parliament, Ombudsman's Office, Anti-Discrimination Commissioner, civil society organizations and the media, increasingly demand accountability of duty-bearers for better governance results for children.

description.narrative: UNICEF assisted Albania's Parliament and national human rights institutions to strengthen their oversight of duty-bearers' accountability for child rights upholding (with focus, in 2016, on the situation of children in detention, in residential care and on the move); civil society partners were supported in strategic litigation cases for child rights. | Status:Met | As-of Date:08/01/2017

title.narrative: % of Albania's regions (Qarqu) having established and functional Child Rights Units

baseline.value: No institutional system for child rights monitoring prior to the adoption of the Law #10347 On the Protection of the Rights of the Child (came into force in June 2011)

target.value: 2014:100%, 12 Child Rights Units (CRUs) to be established and functional in all 12 Regional Councils as part of Albania

actual.value: 2017:CRUs layer replaced by the SACRP direct collaboration with the reformed Municipalities and direct technical supervision of municipal Child Protection Workers

title.narrative: # of mechanisms and structures holding on-going dialogue between interest/user groups /networks/ alliances / CSOs at local and national level

baseline.value: No mechanism for child rights monitoring by civil society prior to the adoption of the Law #10347 On the Protection of the Rights of the Child (came into force in 2011)

target.value: 2014:Child Rights Observatories (CROs) are established and their operational and financial sustainability mechanisms developed in all 12 regions of Albania

actual.value: 2017:Child Rights Observatories are functional at all 12 regions of Albania

title.narrative: # of parliamentary hearings /standing committee discussions annually on child-related issues

actual.value: 2017:At least 7 discussions on issues related to children: 1. Plenary session reviews of the Annual Report of the People's Advocate and of the Commissioner for Protection from Discrimination, including for child rights cases. 2. One public hearing session of the Parliamentary Sub-commission on Children,

title.narrative: % of major child-related complaints effectively addressed by the Ombudsman Office (of the total number submitted to Ombudsman) annually

actual.value: 2017:For 2015: Of 136 cases of child-related concerns reviewed by the People's Advocate 56 (43%) were either resolved positively to the benefit of the children concerned, or followed up with recommendations by the People's Advocate, in favour of the child.
